docs.lead_paragraph: When Senator Barack Obama stepped from his plane on the final ride of his presidential candidacy and loped to the bottom of the stairs, he did something he had not done at the end of any of the thousands of miles logged on this journey. He saluted.

docs.lead_paragraph: At Harvard Law School in 1990, President Obama found himself lovingly mocked by his peers for relentlessly promoting the exotic story of a search for racial identity that later became the theme of his best-selling book, ''Dreams From My Father.'' ''My mother was a backup singer for Abba. They were good folks,'' a student parody of Mr. Obama joked. In Chicago, ''I discovered I was black, and I have remained so ever since.''
docs.abstract: Political Memo; David Maraniss's new biography Barack Obama: The Story claims to document the many ways in which Pres Obama's youthfully constructed narrative in his memoir Dreams From My Father appears to be contradicted by the people and events in his life; book follows reporting in The New York Times and elsewhere over the past six years that has sometimes called into question parts of Obama's life story. Photos (M)

headline.main: Political Memo: Obama Biography Brings New Scrutiny to President's Own Memoir

docs.snippet: At Harvard Law School in 1990, President Obama found himself lovingly mocked by his peers for relentlessly promoting the exotic story of a search for racial identity that later became the theme of his best-selling book, ''Dreams From My Father.'' ...

docs.lead_paragraph: Growing up in Hawaii, President Obama frequently smoked -- and inhaled -- marijuana with a group of friends dubbed the ''Choom Gang,'' according to a new biography due out next month. Large portions of the book, by David Maraniss of The Washington Post, were available online Friday on Google Books, before being taken down. The section about Mr. Obama's pot smoking was first reported by Buzzfeed.
docs.abstract: Caucus column; portions of biography Barack Obama: The Story by David Maraniss made available briefly online reveal more information about Obama's use of marijuana in high school. (S)

headline.main: A Future President's Use Of Marijuana Is Noted

docs.lead_paragraph: HONOLULU - After a peaceful 11-day respite that was heavy on morning workouts and afternoon golf, President Obama wrapped up his Hawaiian vacation on Monday with an action-packed afternoon of family activities. He mingled with locals at Island Snow, his favorite spot for Hawaiian shave ice - he caught a clerk off guard when he flashed a $100 bill to pay for the treats -- and also took his daughters to the military cemetery where his grandfather is buried and later to the Honolulu Zoo.
docs.abstract: President Obama ends his Hawaii trip with a family outing.

headline.main: Obama Wraps Up Hawaii Trip With Family Outing

docs.lead_paragraph: I will not campaign for, vote for or support any candidate, even in my own party, who does not support common-sense gun reform.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Pres Barack Obama calls gun violence sweeping United States national crisis that demands countrywide response; acknowledges sweeping gun control reform will not happen during his presidency, but points to steps he is taking with his legal authority as start; asks citizens and government officials to do their part in reducing violence; in particular urges higher level of accountability and safety standards in gun industry.

headline.main: Barack Obama: Guns Are Our Shared Responsibility

docs.snippet: I will not campaign for, vote for or support any candidate, even in my own party, who does not support common-sense gun reform....

docs.lead_paragraph: In the end, health care reform isn’t about politics and fear. It’s about changing a system that often works better for the health-insurance companies than it does for millions of Americans.
